isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - TRAILER CONNECTION

entry.para: Check Fuse F7-D for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then correct. Replace fuse.
At fuse F7-D measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 14F and 14K, then repair.
Remove stop light relay from connector (464-R10). At (464-R10) measure voltage at circuit 70E to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70E, then repair.
At (464-R10) measure voltage from circuit 70E to 70-G.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 70G if left turn indicator functions, or circuit 56-G if turn indicator does not function. Check 57-G/11-G if right turn indicator does not function. Then repair faulty gnd. circuit.
Check Fuse F3-B for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then correct. Replace fuse.
At fuse F3-B measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuits 14H and 14E, then repair.
Disconnect connector (640). At (640) and circuit 70 measure voltage to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70, then repair.
With brake pedal depressed, measure resistance across terminals of stop light switch.
Reconnect (640) and disconnect (4). With brake pedal depressed, at (4) measure voltage from circuit 70A to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70A, then repair.
Reconnect (4). With brake pedal depressed, at (464-R10) measure voltage from circuit 70D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70D, then repair.
At (464-R10) use test lead to jumper circuit 70E to 70C.
With test jumper still in place, measure voltage at trailer socket (112) red terminal/circuit 70C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 70C, then repair.
Replace defective stop light relay. Stop light circuits check good.
Proceed with this test only if tractor turn signals and hazard flashers work properly. Do turn and hazard lights of tractor function properly?

Go to troubleshooting section
for tractor turn and hazard lights.
Remove turn signal flasher, and use test lead to jumper between circuits 14RD and 14BK.
With left turn signal switch ON, measure voltage at trailer socket (112) yellow terminal/circuit 56C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 56C, then repair.
With right turn signal switch ON, measure voltage at trailer socket (112) green terminal/circuit 57C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 57C, then repair.
Test complete; remove test jumper at flasher and re-install flasher unit.
Proceed with this test only if tractor tail lights work properly. Do tail lights of tractor function properly?

Go to troubleshooting section
for tractor tail lights.
With head light switch ON or in parking light mode, and cab and trailer lights switch ON, measure voltage at trailer socket (112) brown terminal/circuit 68B to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 68B, then repair.
Tail lights circuit checks good. Turn OFF headlight switch.
Again proceed with this test only if tractor tail lights work properly. Do tail lights of tractor function properly?

Go to troubleshooting section
for tractor tail lights.
Remove marker lights relay (463-R8). With trailer lights switch ON and head light switch ON or in parking light mode, measure voltage at (463-R8) circuit 58C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58C, then repair.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair.
At F3-A holder measure voltage from circuit 14E to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 14E, then repair.
Replace fuse F3-A. At (463-R8) measure voltage from circuit 58D to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58D, then repair.
At (463-R8) measure voltage from circuit 58D to 58-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuits 58-GA and 11-G, then repair.
At (463-R8) use test lead to jumper circuit 58D to 58R.
Measure voltage at trailer socket (112) black terminal/circuit 58R to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 58R/58S, then repair.
Replace defective trailer marker lights relay. Marker light circuits check good.
With long test leads, measure resistance between left dash panel ground stud and white terminal of trailer socket (112).
Locate open or poor connection in ground circuit, then Repair. (NOTE: Refer to circuit diagram book for gnd. circuits which vary for different sleeper models.)
